alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued January 23 at 5:57PM PST until January 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, a period of stagnant air with light winds. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in areas of dense fog. * WHERE...In Washington, I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County. In Oregon, Lower Columbia. * WHEN...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 4 PM PST Wednesday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Air stagnation could result in the development and persistence of poor air quality.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. People with respiratory illness should follow their physician`s advice for dealing with high levels of air pollution during periods of stagnant air. State air quality agencies highly recommend that no outdoor burning occur and that residential wood burning devices be limited as much as possible. According to state air quality agencies, prolonged periods of stagnant air can hold pollutants close to the ground where people live and breathe. Check with your local burn agency for any current restrictions in your area.

area.areaDesc: Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County
